If you think you may need help, please call my office at (916) 635-0505 or visit http://bera.house.gov/gethelp  to learn more. We’ve helped return more than $4.5 million in owed benefits to local taxpayers and we’d be honored to help you, too. 7/
As a doctor who has helped care for veterans, I know how much our vets sacrifice for our country – it’s critical we are there to support these heroes. 6/

It turned out that while Sal was approved for his back-pay, the VA had never actually sent his benefits. My office contacted the VA about expediting Sal’s benefits and the situation was resolved within a month. 5/

During this second treatment period, the VA had not yet provided Sal with his back-pay benefits, adding to his stress. As the bills mounted, Sal contacted my office to help with his VA disability claim – we got right to work. 4/
Unfortunately, Sal later received tests that his cancer had returned. It was a very stressful time for Sal and his finances.
He decided to use his Department of Veterans Affairs benefits to pay for his medicine and started responding positively to treatment. 2/
Thread: Meet Sal, an Army veteran and Carmichael native who served during the Vietnam War. He was diagnosed with prostate cancer related to his exposure to Agent Orange. 1/pic.twitter.com/a25ot5iAiX

We all have a responsibility to speak out against hate -- so inspired by those protesting peacefullyhttps://twitter.com/bostonglobe/status/898992683661832192 …
"The strength of the United States is that we are one generation of immigrants after another ... we need to celebrate that"
"And thank God that Steve Bannon's out of the White House"
On Russia: "a foreign government interfered with our election, this should not be a partisan issue ... we need to respond"
On voting rights: "our democracy depends on every citizen exercising their rights to vote"
"Its important we deescalate these tensions. There are openings for diplomacy and we need to take them"
On North Korea: "we must defend Guam, they are part of the United States & we need to stand with our allies in South Korea & Japan"
"As Senator McCain said, lets put country first ... John McCain is a true patriot and deserves our respect"
"It's an embarrassment that the president pulled out of the Paris Climate Agreement. That destroys American leadership and it's wrong."
"You don't need to be a scientist to listen to scientists: the earth is warming. That's a fact."
"The president's budget is a reflection of his priorities ... what he specifically zeroes out are earth sciences, thats climate change"
"Far too many kids today who have the talent and the desire, they're being priced out of higher education."
On education: "Im the product of California public school education all the way ... from grade school through medical school"
"My disappointment is the president didn't rise to the occasion and speak out against hate"
On racism and Charlottesville: "shame on us if we don't take this time to rise up -- we need to call out hate."
On net neutrality: "the internet should be free and open to every American ... the Trump administration does not have that view"
"In the plan we've put out, we should allow folks to buy into Medicare"
On health care: "we have to seek universal coverage ... an idea we put out there was giving folks the ability to buy into Medicare"
On North Korea: "We have a responsibility to seek diplomacy and not needlessly put our men & women who serve in danger"
"I have serious concerns with America isolating itself now ... the 20th century was a prosperous century because of American leadership."
"We've helped over 8000 people retrieve benefits back from the federal government - those are seniors, veterans and constituents like you"
.@RepBera: "our staff have recovered over $4 million dollars of benefits for our constituents in Sacramento"pic.twitter.com/uHkOfhwVTS

These are common sense ideas to make the Affordable Care Act work better for American families – ideas that both parties should support.
Health care is about putting the patient’s health first. We must reduce costs & increase those insured - that's exactly what these plans do
Make smart changes: align open enrollment w/ tax season. Draw bidding areas to help rural America #ProtectOurCare
Create affordable options: provide premium support by age & geography. Create more options for older Americans #ProtectOurCare
Promote enrollment: In #CA, markets are stable b/c more folks are enrolled. This expands the pool & reduces costs #ProtectOurCare
Keep costs down for lower income families: guarantee cost sharing reduction payments. These reduce copays & deductibles #ProtectOurCare
Protect people with pre-existing conditions: create dedicated reinsurance fund to control premiums #ProtectOurCare
Here are FIVE ideas to improve the #ACA that stabilize and improve the marketplace #ProtectOurCare
